creator: I Am Sober LLC
descriptionHtml:
I Am Sober more than just a free sobriety counter app.

Along with tracking your sober days, it helps you build new habits and provides ongoing motivation by connecting you to a wide network of people all striving for the same goal: staying sober one day at a time.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have worked for you.

**The I Am Sober app features:**

• Sober day tracker
To visualize how long you’ve been sober.

• Daily pledges & review
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

• Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved by being sober.

• Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last.

• Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

• Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

• Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

• Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to break, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs.

• Additional resources
If you’re struggling to stay sober, view the additional resources and find rehab centers or therapists near you. Staying sober isn’t easy; it takes a large network of support to quit drinking or stop doing drugs. The I Am Sober app is meant to connect you in as many ways as possible so you have a 24 hour companion and a wide network for your recovery.
descriptionShort: A better you one day at a time

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This is a small patch release with bug fixes.

In case you missed the notes on our last release, you can now edit your stories!
Once stories are posted, they can now be edited within 24 hours of being posted.

More to come soon!

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This release includes some addiction and community reorganization!

Additions include:

- A new BFRB community for skin picking, hair pulling, and nail biting.
- New addictions for adderall, vaping, masturbation, energy drinks, and fentanyl.

Another community change you might notice is that you'll now have a Following feed. This is a new feed of stories, just from the people you're following.

Another improvement included is better notifications to keep you informed of what's happening.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This release includes:
- Added Xanax and Benzos to the main list of addictions
- Fix to correctly display the height of images on detail screens.
- Several smaller bug fixes.
- Prep work for localization (more languages coming soon - stay tuned!)

**Support providers:**

I Am Sober is currently developing the ability to pair with support providers. This would allow you to message your provider on a safe and secure platform, as well as share your daily activities with them. Support providers might include:

• Family members
• Recovery coaches
• Counselors, psychologists, therapists
• Inpatient and outpatient treatment centers

This program is currently in beta. Please reach out to sales@iamsober.com for more information.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
For our Apple users, this release includes an improvement to our Apple Watch app to include Complications! This lets you add your sober time to various clock faces and lets you quickly access the Watch app.

This is also includes our first translation - we now support the German language.

To all you German-speaking sobriety seekers, welcome to I Am Sober!

title: I Am Sober

creator: I Am Sober LLC
descriptionHtml:
I Am Sober more than just a free sobriety counter app.

Along with tracking your sober days, it helps you build new habits and provides ongoing motivation by connecting you to a wide network of people all striving for the same goal: staying sober one day at a time.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have worked for you.

**The I Am Sober app features:**

• Sober day tracker
To visualize how long you’ve been sober.

• Daily pledges & review
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

• Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved by being sober.

• Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last.

• Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

• Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

• Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

• Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to break, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs.

**Support providers:**

I Am Sober is currently developing the ability to pair with support providers. This would allow you to message your provider on a safe and secure platform, as well as share your daily activities with them. Support providers might include:

• Family members
• Recovery coaches
• Counselors, psychologists, therapists
• Inpatient and outpatient treatment centers

This program is currently in beta. Please reach out to sales@iamsober.com for more information.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This release includes:
- Official support for the Russian language! 🇷🇺
- A new Vaporwave skin.
- Include haptic feedback for certain actions.
- Must be authenticated now in order to add a reaction.
- To reduce harmful images, you can no longer post images to a few addiction/milestone combinations.
- More small bug fixes and improvements.

descriptionShort: A better you one day at a time

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
2021 here we come!
- A new motivation pack: I Am True to Myself.
- Bumped up the number of people you can follow.
- Removed the term "user" from our notifications.
- Make input text for dark themed skins more readable.
- Fix for deleting custom addiction bug.
- Support for Norwegian language.
- Support for Finnish language.
- Several language updates for improved translations.
- General security improvements and bug fixes.

descriptionShort: A better you one day at a time

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This release includes some big improvements to savings.
- Added the ability track savings by calories.
- Added a toggle for daily vs weekly spending.
- Added a custom savings type.
- Ability to handle larger savings amounts.
- Removed lame number pickers and moved to a number pad entry.

We also made some privacy improvements with our community blocking feature. Now when you block someone, they will no longer be able to see any of your posts or comments.

title: I Am Sober

creator: I Am Sober LLC
descriptionHtml:
I Am Sober is more than just a free sobriety counter app.

Along with tracking your sober days, it helps you build new habits and provides ongoing motivation by connecting you to a wide network of people all striving for the same goal: staying sober one day at a time.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have worked for you.

**The I Am Sober app features:**

• Sober day tracker
To visualize how long you’ve been sober.

• Remember why you quit
Add reasons and photos to help you remember why you want to quit your addiction and stay sober.

• Daily pledge tracker
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

• Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved by being sober.

• Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last.

• Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

• Milestone tracker

• Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

• Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to break, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs.

**Sober Plus subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

• Create a group
Stay accountable together and track your sobriety privately. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous, NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

• Locked access
Keep your trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

• Data Backups
Save your progress in the cloud and restore your trackers if you get a new device.

• More tracking
Track more addictions and get access to more communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drugs, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.

When you create an account and declare your addiction, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

• Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to break, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs.

**Sober Plus subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

• Create a group
Stay accountable together and track your sobriety privately. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous, NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

• Locked access
Keep your trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

• Data Backups
Save your progress in the cloud and restore your trackers if you get a new device.

• More tracking
Track more addictions and get access to more communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drugs, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: A better you one day at a time

Track and celebrate your milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

• Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

• Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to break, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs.

**Sober Plus subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

• Create a group
Stay accountable together and track your sobriety privately. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous, NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

• Locked access
Keep your trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

• Data Backups
Save your progress in the cloud and restore your trackers if you get a new device.

• More tracking
Track more addictions and get access to more communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drugs, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: A better you one day at a time

Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

• Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved by being sober.

• Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last.

• Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

• Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

• Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

• Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to break, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs.

**Sober Plus subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

• Create a group
Stay accountable together and track your sobriety privately. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous, NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

• Locked access
Keep your trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

• Data Backups
Save your progress in the cloud and restore your trackers if you get a new device.

• More tracking
Track more addictions and get access to more communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drugs, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This release includes some long-awaited features:
- Your account page now includes an activity feed of recent notifications. Now you can find the people that have been reacting and commenting on your posts.
- The text above your sober clock can now be customized so you can word things in a way that best represents your sobriety.

This also includes some fixes:
- Fix for not loading more followers/following on large screens.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have worked for you.

**The I Am Sober app features:**

• Sober day tracker
To visualize how long you’ve been sober.

• Remember why you quit
Add reasons and photos to help you remember why you want to quit your addiction and stay sober.

• Daily pledge tracker
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

• Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved by being sober.

• Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last.

• Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

• Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

• Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

• Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to break, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs.

**Sober Plus subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

• Create a group
Stay accountable together and track your sobriety privately. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous, NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

• Locked access
Keep your trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

• Data Backups
Save your progress in the cloud and restore your trackers if you get a new device.

• More tracking
Track more addictions and get access to more communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drugs, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: A better you one day at a time

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This release includes:
- Pledge review dates and start dates are now synced up. If you marked "No" in your daily review on certain days, these will now reflect properly in your calendar.
- You can now also interact with your calendar and adjust your start dates.
- Fixes an issue where some people weren't able to change their username.
- Official support for the Czech language!

title: I Am Sober: Sobriety Tracker

creator: I Am Sober LLC
descriptionHtml:
I Am Sober is more than just a free sobriety counter app.

Along with tracking your sober days, it helps you build new habits and provides ongoing motivation by connecting you to a wide network of people all striving for the same goal: staying sober one day at a time.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have worked for you.

The I Am Sober App Features:

► Sober day tracker
Visualize how long you’ve been sober and monitor your sobriety journey.

► Remember why you quit your addiction
Add reasons and photos to help you remember why you want to quit your addiction and stay sober.

► Daily pledge tracker
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

► Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved since you quit by being sober.

► Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last.

► Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

► Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs.

Sober Plus Subscriptions

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable together and track your sobriety privately. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous, NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.

title: I Am Sober: Sobriety Tracker

creator: I Am Sober LLC
descriptionHtml:
I Am Sober is more than just a free sobriety counter app.

Along with tracking your sober days, it helps you build new habits and provides ongoing motivation by connecting you to a wide network of people all striving for the same goal: staying sober one day at a time.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have worked for you.

The I Am Sober App Features:

► Sober day tracker
Visualize how long you’ve been sober and monitor your sobriety journey.

► Remember why you quit your addiction
Add reasons and photos to help you remember why you want to quit your addiction and stay sober.

► Daily pledge tracker
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

► Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved since you quit by being sober.

► Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last.

► Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

► Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs.

Sober Plus Subscriptions

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable together and track your sobriety privately. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous, NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: Track your addiction recovery daily. Quit drinking alcohol. Form better habits.

► Sober day tracker

► Sobriety calculator

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

View how much money & time you’ve saved since you quit by being sober.

► Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last. Track your habits and be aware of the change.

► Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your recovery progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

► Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

**Sober Plus Subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable and recover together. Track your sobriety privately with the help of anonymous meetings. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: Track your addiction recovery daily. Quit drinking alcohol. Form better habits.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:

Lastly, this also includes some fixes to our notification system.

creator: I Am Sober LLC
descriptionHtml:
I Am Sober is more than just a free sobriety counter app.

Along with tracking your sober days, it helps you build new habits and provides ongoing motivation by connecting you to a wide network of people all striving for the same goal: staying sober one day at a time.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have helped you quit your addiction.

**The I Am Sober App Features:**

► Sober day tracker
Visualize how long you’ve been sober and monitor your sobriety journey over time. Track the time you spend without drinking, smoking, etc. Count your sober days.

► Remember why you quit your addiction
Add reasons and photos to help you remember why you want to quit your addiction, stay sober and build new habits. Get motivated and enjoy your recovery.

► Daily pledge tracker
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

► Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved since you quit by being sober.

► Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last. Track your habits and be aware of the change.

► Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your recovery progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

► Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

**Sober Plus Subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable and recover together. Track your sobriety privately with the help of anonymous meetings. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: Track your addiction recovery daily. Quit drinking alcohol. Form better habits.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
Happy New Year sober friends! This release includes some major updates to our app's infrastructure. The changes may not be noticeable on the surface, but there are a ton of improvements and fixes that were made behind the scenes.

We have a lot of great stuff planned for 2023, and very thankful for all your input and feedback. Please keep it coming!

title: I Am Sober

creator: I Am Sober LLC
descriptionHtml:
I Am Sober is more than just a free sobriety counter app.

Along with tracking your sober days, it helps you build new habits and provides ongoing motivation by connecting you to a wide network of people all striving for the same goal: staying sober one day at a time.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have helped you quit your addiction.

**The I Am Sober App Features:**

► Sober day tracker
Visualize how long you’ve been sober and monitor your sobriety journey over time. Track the time you spend without drinking, smoking, etc. Count your sober days.

► Remember why you quit your addiction
Add reasons and photos to help you remember why you want to quit your addiction, stay sober and build new habits. Get motivated and enjoy your recovery.

► Daily pledge tracker
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

► Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved since you quit by being sober.

► Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last. Track your habits and be aware of the change.

► Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your recovery progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

► Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

**Sober Plus Subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable and recover together. Track your sobriety privately with the help of anonymous meetings. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: Track your addiction recovery daily. Quit drinking alcohol. Form better habits.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: This release adds the ability to report user profiles for posting inappropriate content or other community guideline violations.

title: I Am Sober

creator: I Am Sober LLC
descriptionHtml:
I Am Sober is more than just a free sobriety counter app.

Along with tracking your sober days, it helps you build new habits and provides ongoing motivation by connecting you to a wide network of people all striving for the same goal: staying sober one day at a time.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have helped you quit your addiction.

**The I Am Sober App Features:**

► Sober day tracker
Visualize how long you’ve been sober and monitor your sobriety journey over time. Track the time you spend without drinking, smoking, etc. Count your sober days.

► Remember why you quit your addiction
Add reasons and photos to help you remember why you want to quit your addiction, stay sober and build new habits. Get motivated and enjoy your recovery.

► Daily pledge tracker
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

► Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved since you quit by being sober.

► Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last. Track your habits and be aware of the change.

► Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your recovery progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

► Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

**Sober Plus Subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable and recover together. Track your sobriety privately with the help of anonymous meetings. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: Track your addiction recovery daily. Quit drinking alcohol. Form better habits.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: Track your addiction recovery daily. Quit drinking alcohol. Form better habits.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: This release includes the ability to log your past usage before you started tracking so you can see your progress. It also includes some fixes and infrastructure updates for better performance.

title: I Am Sober

creator: I Am Sober LLC
descriptionHtml:
I Am Sober is more than just a free sobriety counter app.

Along with tracking your sober days, it helps you build new habits and provides ongoing motivation by connecting you to a wide network of people all striving for the same goal: staying sober one day at a time.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have helped you quit your addiction.

**The I Am Sober App Features:**

► Sober day tracker
Visualize how long you’ve been sober and monitor your sobriety journey over time. Track the time you spend without drinking, smoking, etc. Count your sober days.

► Remember why you quit your addiction
Add reasons and photos to help you remember why you want to quit your addiction, stay sober and build new habits. Get motivated and enjoy your recovery.

► Daily pledge tracker
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

► Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved since you quit by being sober.

► Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last. Track your habits and be aware of the change.

► Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your recovery progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

► Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

**Sober Plus Subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable and recover together. Track your sobriety privately with the help of anonymous meetings. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: Track your addiction recovery daily. Quit drinking alcohol. Form better habits.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This release includes the long-requested ability to like comments in the community. Now when someone leaves a supportive or helpful comment, you can show them some appreciation.

It also includes a couple of fixes including one where you may sometimes see "Nothing to review" on the milestone review screen.

► Create a group

title: I Am Sober

creator: I Am Sober LLC
descriptionHtml:
I Am Sober is more than just a free sobriety counter app.

Along with tracking your sober days, it helps you build new habits and provides ongoing motivation by connecting you to a wide network of people all striving for the same goal: staying sober one day at a time.

Through our growing sober community you can learn from others and contribute by sharing insights and tactics that have helped you quit your addiction.

**The I Am Sober App Features:**

► Sober day tracker
Visualize how long you’ve been sober and monitor your sobriety journey over time. Track the time you spend without drinking, smoking, etc. Count your sober days.

► Remember why you quit your addiction
Add reasons and photos to help you remember why you want to quit your addiction, stay sober and build new habits. Get motivated and enjoy your recovery.

► Daily pledge tracker
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

► Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved since you quit by being sober.

► Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last. Track your habits and be aware of the change.

► Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your recovery progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

► Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

**Sober Plus Subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable and recover together. Track your sobriety privately with the help of anonymous meetings. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.

What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

**Sober Plus Subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable and recover together. Track your sobriety privately with the help of anonymous meetings. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.

Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

**Sober Plus Subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable and recover together. Track your sobriety privately with the help of anonymous meetings. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.

Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

► Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved since you quit by being sober.

► Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last. Track your habits and be aware of the change.

► Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your recovery progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

► Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

**Sober Plus Subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable and recover together. Track your sobriety privately with the help of anonymous meetings. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.

**The I Am Sober App Features:**

► Sober day tracker
Visualize how long you’ve been sober and monitor your sobriety journey over time. Track the time you spend without drinking, smoking, etc. Count your sober days.

► Remember why you quit your addiction
Add reasons and photos to help you remember why you want to quit your addiction, stay sober and build new habits. Get motivated and enjoy your recovery.

► Daily pledge tracker
Take a pledge every day. Sobriety is a 24-hour struggle, so start your day off by making a pledge to stay sober. Then you can review how your day went and log notes at the end of the day.

► Sobriety calculator
View how much money & time you’ve saved since you quit by being sober.

► Analyze triggers
Recap each day and find patterns that made your day easier or more challenging than the last. Track your habits and be aware of the change.

► Share your story
Either with others or for yourself, take photos and journal your recovery progress directly in the app. Then choose to share it or save it as a reminder for yourself.

► Milestone tracker
Track and celebrate your recovery milestones from 1 day, to 1 week, to 1 month and beyond. Compare experiences with others on their sober journey. Read how they felt at this milestone and what you can expect. If you’re struggling, share your story and invite others to offer help or advice.

► Withdrawal timeline
When you create an account and declare your addiction you want to quit, you can instantly see a withdrawal timeline to get an idea of what to expect for your next few days (and weeks). What’s more, you can contribute to it. See how many others saw an increase in their restfulness vs those that saw an increase in anxiety. Prepare yourself for what’s to come in recovery.

► Customize your experience
You set the time, your sober birthday, the category of motivation you need, the addictions you’re trying to quit, even the end-of-day summaries. Make the app customized to your lifestyle and tailored to your needs and habits.

**Sober Plus Subscriptions**

I Am Sober is free to use, but you can support development of the app with a subscription to Sober Plus. With Sober Plus, you'll get access to these premium features:

► Create a group
Stay accountable and recover together. Track your sobriety privately with the help of anonymous meetings. Groups are great for complimenting your real-world group like Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), NA, SA, SMART Recovery, or your rehab center.

► Locked access
Keep your sobriety trackers private with a lock that you can access via TouchID or FaceID.

► Data Backups
Save your recovery progress in the cloud and restore your sobriety trackers if you get a new device.

► Sobriety counter for all addictions
Track more addictions and get access to more recovery communities. Even if your addiction is specific like Wine, Online Shopping, or Skin Picking, you’ll find a variety of communities of people who are all trying to get sober from alcohol, drinking, drugs, smoking, eating disorders, self-harm, and more.
descriptionShort: Track your addiction recovery daily. Quit drinking alcohol. Form better habits.
